definition: United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗

sentences.english: KMT-CCP cooperation ensured the War against Japan .
sentences.chinese: 國共合作是抗日戰爭勝利的根本保證。

sentences.english: With the development of modern education, and public education concept has changed.
sentences.chinese: 第一次國共合作期間，廣州近代教育事業發展迅速。

sentences.english: Japanese wins KMT-CPC cooperation, national self-reliance of the world pass.
sentences.chinese: 國共合作抗日勝，民族自強世界傳。

sentences.english: Comintern concession in the compromise policy, the cooperation between the Kuomintang and eventually rupture.
sentences.chinese: 在共產國際妥協退讓的政策下，國共合作最終破裂。

definition: Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
